channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 在过去的四分之一个世纪里，私募股权公司每年的分红约占基金价值的 25%。但到 2023 年，这一比例已降至 11.2%。投资者越来越不耐烦 👇
item.description:
Over the past quarter of a century, private-­equity firms have churned out distributions worth around 25% of fund values each year. But by 2023 they had fallen to just 11.2%. Investors are growing impatient https://t.co/bpDNLCixNh 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 事实证明，俄罗斯政权远未崩溃。弗拉基米尔-普京的野心构成的长期威胁远不止乌克兰。美国和欧洲已经押注于两种战略。他们必须考虑另外两种战略。
item.description:
Far from collapsing Russia’s regime has proved resilient. And Vladimir Putin’s ambitions pose a long-­term threat that goes far beyond Ukraine.

What should the West do? America and Europe have bet on two strategies. They must consider two more https://t.co/Cu7dFMdZye 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 20 世纪 70 年代，因收购《每日电讯报》和《旁观者》而闻名的巴克利兄弟濒临破产。为了生存，他们不得不铤而走险。他们所做的这笔 50 年前的交易至今仍具有现实意义👇。
item.description:
In the 1970s the Barclay brothers—best known for buying the Telegraph and the Spectator—were on the verge of insolvency. If they were to survive, they needed to resort to desperate measures.

The 50-year-old deal they made is still relevant today https://t.co/45MJZpsRsW 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 一种新技术正在加速人工智能模型的训练过程 👇
item.description:
A new technique is speeding up the process of training AI models https://t.co/RTfIthLRgo 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 近几十年来，全球价值观发生了重大转变，而且是非同寻常的转变。探索我们的互动平台，了解它是什么👇。
item.description:
In recent decades there has been a substantial shift in global values—and an extraordinary one. Explore our interactive to discover what it is https://t.co/tsRSFBYRJw 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 凯文-卡萨斯-萨莫拉（Kevin Casas-Zamora）警告说，在一个极度不确定的时代维护民主 "需要的不仅仅是防守"。
item.description:
Preserving democracy in an age of radical uncertainty “requires more than playing defence”, warns Kevin Casas-Zamora.

In a guest essay the political scientist argues that it is time to re-evaluate social contracts https://t.co/q8gl6XkABc

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 投资者为何将资金投入基础设施资产？本周的 "Money Talks "播客将为您揭晓答案： 🎧
item.description:
Why are investors pouring money into infrastructure assets? Find out on this week’s “Money Talks” podcast: https://t.co/Gq3I6xTJxa 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 1984 年，鸟山明推出了一个故事，第一次成功地将漫画推向西方，继而推向全球。我们怀念《龙珠》创作者👇 的一生。
item.description:
In 1984, Toriyama Akira introduced a story which, for the first time, carried manga successfully to the West and then across the globe.

We remember the life of the “Dragon Ball” creator https://t.co/GcyRwuRSGl 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 纽约人对丑陋的脚手架已经深恶痛绝，去年市长发起了一场清除街头丑陋脚手架的运动。现在，计算机科学家利用人工智能👇 列出了一份可能的目标清单。
item.description:
New Yorkers have grown so sick of ugly scaffolding that last year the mayor launched a campaign to clear it from the streets.

Now computer scientists have made a hit list of possible targets using AI https://t.co/tdvKqQMcfv 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 高品质的沙子非常稀缺：每年开采的 500 亿吨左右的沙子中，只有不到 1% 可以用来生产普通玻璃。随着需求的增长，采矿者（包括合法采矿者和非法采矿者）窥探到了商机👇。
item.description:
High­-quality sand is scarce: of the 50bn or so tonnes extracted each year, less than 1% can be used to produce regular glass. Miners, both legitimate and otherwise, spy an opportunity as demand rises https://t.co/tOfXogsZLe 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 卡昆古面具被苏库人和亚卡人尊崇为祖先的战争象征，他们相信面具能赋予战士神奇的力量，使他们刀枪不入。面具的回归似乎激化了刚果的暴力冲突。
item.description:
The Kakungu mask is venerated by both the Suku and Yaka people as an ancestral symbol of war.

They believe it confers magical powers on their fighters, making them invulnerable to bullets. Its return appears to have inflamed violence in Congo https://t.co/5V4wuFIBII 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 这六本书包括一本前基督教感性诗集和一本讨论第八宗罪的书，有助于解释性与宗教之间的关系 👇。
item.description:
These six books, which include a collection of pre-Christian sensuous poetry and one that discusses the eighth deadly sin, help explain the relationship between sex and religion https://t.co/oRnS08z1vB 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 英格兰的历史建筑令人头疼。保护建筑的程序是否需要更新？ Alamy
item.description:
England’s historic buildings are causing headaches. Does the process for protecting architecture need an update? https://t.co/oWEbi8lgrA

Image: Alamy pic.twitter.com/trUwpgVcbF

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 除了欧洲，其他地方都在向上、向高、向天空发展。了解为什么欧洲是被高楼建筑商遗忘的半岛 👇。
item.description:
Everywhere is building upwards, higher, further into the sky—except Europe. Read why it is the peninsula that tower-builders forgot https://t.co/58FHFNkryB 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 西方必须认识到将其非洲政策外包给不认同其价值观的国家的危险；非洲国家也应了解让自己成为别人地缘政治游戏中的棋子的风险👇。
item.description:
The West must see the danger of outsourcing its Africa policies to countries that do not share its values; and African countries should know the risks of letting themselves be used as pawns in someone else’s geopolitical games https://t.co/tEt8GT6Dfv 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 从对巨型项目的探讨，到关于金融领域最重要、最被忽视的问题之一的引人入胜的书籍，我们精选了九本书，加入您的阅读清单👇。
item.description:
From an exploration of megaprojects to a compelling book on one of the most important and neglected questions in finance, we’ve picked out nine titles to add to your reading list https://t.co/HhMfJQhjuP 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 一本新书打破了 "西方 "或 "欧洲 "文明的基本概念。即使是经验丰富的历史爱好者也会发现许多新颖而引人入胜的内容 👇
item.description:
A new book demolishes the underlying concept of “Western” or “European” civilisation. Even seasoned history buffs will find much that is new and fascinating https://t.co/CyfolsjFTb 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: "西方必须明白，政治犯是西方在俄罗斯境内的主要盟友，"纳坦-沙兰斯基（Natan Sharansky）在一篇特约撰文中指出。
item.description:
“The West must understand that political prisoners are its main allies inside Russia,” argues Natan Sharansky in a guest essay.

Rather than express “concern” for their fate, he believes it must develop much harder tactics to ensure their freedom https://t.co/InJaAtaddv

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 睡眠对人类健康至关重要。它占据了人一生中约三分之一的时间。然而，人们对它的了解却少得令人吃惊。一篇新论文试图填补一些空白 👇。
item.description:
Sleep is essential to human health. It takes up around one-third of people’s lives. And yet surprisingly little is known about it. A new paper attempts to fill some of the gaps https://t.co/E98R9eNkaM 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 作为缓和与中国的惩罚性贸易战努力的一部分，中国看来终于要打开澳大利亚葡萄酒的流通之门了。中国的葡萄酒爱好者将为此干杯： 👇
item.description:
At last China looks set to uncork the flow of Australian wine, as part of an effort to de-escalate its punitive trade war with the country. Chinese oenophiles will drink to that: https://t.co/Llnf61nzuD 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 许多海地人说，他们不仅想摆脱外国势力的束缚，还想摆脱那些听命于外国势力的海地精英的束缚。但是，新政府不可能使国家摆脱不安全和非法性👇。
item.description:
Many Haitians say they want to throw off the shackles not only of foreign powers but of the elite Haitians who, they say, do their bidding. But a new government is unlikely to free the country from insecurity and illegitimacy https://t.co/NO0JjSc9jp 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 芯片大战为拉美最大经济体的高科技增长创造了机遇。但它们能否在机会溜走之前抓住它们？ 👇
item.description:
The chip wars have created opportunities for high-tech growth among Latin America’s biggest economies. But will they seize them before they slip away? https://t.co/77dv1HDbni 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 祖父母与子女的比例比以往任何时候都高。这将带来严重后果 👇
item.description:
The ratio of grandparents to children is higher than ever before. That has big consequences https://t.co/DFy5wmtcDe 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 作为缓和与中国的惩罚性贸易战努力的一部分，中国看来终于要打开澳大利亚葡萄酒的流通之门了。中国的葡萄酒爱好者将为此干杯： 盖蒂图片社
item.description:
At last China looks set to uncork the flow of Australian wine, as part of an effort to de-escalate its punitive trade war with the country. Chinese oenophiles will drink to that: https://t.co/ohMzDKMvNe

Image: Getty Images pic.twitter.com/7bApLED18D

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 当中国银行家的日子不好过。中国共产党希望他们放弃 "享乐主义 "的生活方式，更加爱国。在我们的 "鼓楼 "播客中，@aliceysu 和 @DSORennie 将解释这场新的意识形态运动背后的真正原因： 🎧
item.description:
It’s a bad time to be a Chinese banker. The Communist Party wants them to abandon “hedonistic” lifestyles and be more patriotic.

On our “Drum Tower” podcast, @aliceysu and @DSORennie explain what’s really behind this new ideological campaign: https://t.co/4OCmaNgxAN 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 中国的惩罚性关税几乎断绝了澳大利亚葡萄酒的进口。但中国的 "酸葡萄 "事件可能已经结束 👇。
item.description:
Punitive Chinese tariffs have all but wiped out imports of Australian wine. But China’s case of sour grapes may be over https://t.co/G6I2TGw7Ie 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 纽约人在地铁上什么都见过，从老鼠搬运披萨到舞者后空翻。然而，最近在旋转门附近出现的武装士兵却让人感到不安👇。
item.description:
New Yorkers have seen it all on the subway, from rats carrying pizza to dancers doing backflips. Yet the recent arrival of armed soldiers near the turnstiles has been unnerving https://t.co/SmldLmtZyx 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 你不知道的六本宣传书籍 👇
item.description:
Six books you didn’t know were propaganda https://t.co/PefUuImdFz 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: 自 2022 年澳大利亚人选出工党政府以来，该国与中国的关系有所改善。但一些情报官员担心，"稳定 "的关系可能会被视为中国威胁正在减弱的迹象👇。
item.description:
Since Australians elected a Labor government in 2022 the country’s relationship with China has improved. But some intelligence officials worry that a “stabilised” relationship might be taken as a sign that the Chinese threat is abating https://t.co/q11E1MUV7I 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024

item.title: @nealemahoney 说，美国经济状况与消费者情绪之间的差距 "非常不寻常"。但他预测，选民将在大选前 "消化 "通货膨胀的影响🎧。
item.description:
The gap between how well America’s economy is doing and consumer sentiment is “very unusual” says @nealemahoney. But he predicts that voters will have “digested” the impact of inflation by the time of the election https://t.co/Vxp10glvAD 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 17, 2024
